author: aryanXmahajan
text:
someone books a call with you what do most people do?

send a calendar invite and wait 5 days for the call

completely wasting the warmest moment in the entire funnel

here's what i do instead:

the SECOND someone books they enter an automated sequence designed to close them before we ever speak

email 1 (immediate): "thanks for booking - while you wait here's a video breaking down exactly how we'll approach your situation"

email 2 (next day): case study of someone in their exact position "this is what we did for [similar business]"

email 3 (day 3): "here's our complete playbook on [their pain point] - this is what we'll implement together"

email 4 (day before call): "quick reminder for tomorrow - i reviewed your responses and here's what i'm thinking we should focus on"

by the time they hop on the call they've: consumed 3-4 pieces of high-trust content seen proof you've solved this exact problem understood your methodology realized you actually care

the call becomes a consultation not a pitch

most show up saying "i've already decided i want to work with you i just have a few questions about the process"

credit card ready

this is the difference between "selling" and "enrolling"

when your content does the heavy lifting sales calls become collaborative conversations about implementation

i've had calls where prospects say "i binged all your content i already know this works just tell me where to send payment"

that's the power of strategic nurture

most people think more content = more noise wrong

more STRATEGIC content = more trust = easier closes

the content you send between booking and calling is the highest-leverage content in your entire funnel

because you KNOW they're interested you KNOW they have the problem you KNOW they're evaluating you

use that window
